thread.title: Germaine de Randamie beats Holly Holm to win featherweight title on historic night at UFC 208 in Brooklyn
thread.title_full: Germaine de Randamie beats Holly Holm to win featherweight title on historic night at UFC 208 in Brooklyn

author: Martin Domin
title: Germaine de Randamie beats Holly Holm to win featherweight title on historic night at UFC 208 in Brooklyn
text:
Germaine de Randamie beats Holly Holm to win featherweight title on historic night at UFC 208 in Brooklyn In the co-main event, Anderson Silva earned a controversial victory over Derek Brunson Share Holly Holm exchanges punches with Germaine de Randamie (Photo: Getty Images North America) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Germaine de Randamie was crowned the UFC's first female featherweight champion after a narrow victory over Holly Holm. 
De Randamie started well in the UFC 208 main event in Brooklyn and held on to claim an historic victory in the first fight in the newly-created women's 145lb division. 
All three judges scored the fight 48-47 in the 32-year-old's favour as Holm slipped to her third successive defeat. 
De Randamie edged the first two rounds with her cleaner striking and her right counter could hardly miss as Holm lurched forward with little success. 
But the Dutchwoman landed a hard right hand after the buzzer sounded for the end of the second session which wobbled Holm as she returned to her corner. 
The former bantamweight champion continued to struggle with her distance, aware as she was of De Randamie's power. 
Again, however, De Randamie landed shots after the bell but she was let off with a second warning from referee Todd Anderson. 
Holm continually looked manoeuvred De Randamie against the cage but although the takedown eluded her, she did control the action in the clinch. 
A similar pattern developed in the final round to leave the result in the judges' hands. 
De Randamiwe said: "It was a close fight but I came to fight and she didn't want to fight me. You cannot knock me out like that. 
"She got me with a good head kick but I kept fighting. I hoped she was going fight with me. I love to brawl, I love to fight." 
IO want to fight erone and if CC is the one I need to fight I will fight her. I need to get suerger on my hand first." 
In the co-main event, Anderson Silva was a controversial winner over Derek Brunson - his first victory since 2012. 
The MMA legend looked to have lost at least two rounds against the younger man but was instead given the nod by all three judges. 
The Brazilian was emotional after the result was announced, and said: "I've worked hard for a long time and I just put my heart in it all the time. I'm too old for fighting, these guys are too strong." Anderson Silva of Brazil reacts after his win by unanimous decision against Derek Brunson (Photo: Getty Images North America) Derek Brunson lands a punch against Anderson Silva (Photo: Getty Images North America) 
Earlier, and in the same middleweight division, Jacare Souza made short work of Tim Boetsch, submitting him in the first round to stay on track for a title shot later this year. 
There were also victories for Glover Teixeira over Jared Cannonier and for Dustin Poirier against Jim Miller. UFC 208 results 
Holly Holm vs Germaine de Randamie Anderson Silva bt Derek Brunson via unanimous decision (29-28, 29-28, 30-27) Jacare Souza bt Tim Boetsch via submission (Kimura) Glover Teixeira bt Jared Cannonier via unanimous decision (30-26, 30-26, 30-26) Dustin Poirier bt Jim Miller via majority decision (28-28, 30-27, 29-28) Ronaldo Souza of Brazil takes down Tim Boetsch (Photo: Zuffa LLC) (Photo: Zuffa LLC) Dustin Poirier punches Jim Miller (Photo: Zuffa LLC) 
Undercard Belal Muhammad bt Randy Brown via unanimous decision (30-27, 30-27, 29-28) Wilson Reis bt Ulka Sasaki via unanimous decision (29-28, 29-28, 29-28) Islam Makhachev bt Nik Lentz via unanimous decision (30-25, 30-25, 30-27) Rick Glenn bt Phillipe Nover via split decision (27-30, 29-28, 29-28) Ryan LaFlare bt Roan Carneiro via unanimous decision (30-26, 30-27, 29-28) Like us on Facebook
